name: eglantine
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an old type of rose with simple pink flowers, many thorns (= small, sharp points on the stems), and a sweet smell like apples: Eglantines are the European relation of Rosa primula and grow in British hedgerows. The stone wall was overhung with ivy, eglantine, and clematis.
More examplesFewer examplesHawthorn, teasels, and eglantine all basked in sunshine.From beneath the old oaks and eglantines came the cries of children.The eglantine is better known as sweetbriar, and is very popular in English cottage gardens.
